title.narrative: Output indicator 1.1: Community social cohesion mechanism created and/or supported
Community social cohesion mechanism created and/or supported. Indicator: # of community-based organizations created and/or created

target.value: 1. 35 community mechanisms established and capacitated in the liberated areas (25 LPCs. 4 women groups and 6 youth platforms)

actual.value: 1. Five Women Peace Groups have been formed and trained in Salahaldeen and Kirkuk in addition to Sinjar. Talefer. and Nineavh Plain to advocate for social cohesion and peaceful coexistence in their communities and to assist Local Peace Committees in resolving community conflicts which are particularly of women concern. 151 women from Salahaldeen. Kirkuk Sinjar. Talefer. & Nineavh. Dayla & Ninevah Plain participated in the indicated activities. Representation of all sects and religions have been reflected in these groups. They are the first peace groups to be established in these three areas.

target.value: 1. 35 Established mechanisms are functional and delivering results in the liberated areas 2. 3 community networks of youth and women created 3. 50 public sessoions 4. 10 champions are identified and rectruited.

actual.value:
1. There are currently 24 LPCs, 4 YGs, and 5 WGs, 3 of which were active during this year. UNDP is in the process to establish and capacitate 4 new LPCs in Diyala and Kirkuk governorates.
2. While no formal community network has yet been established, preliminary steps to do so continue to be underway. Through regular communication with the YGs and WGs, a platform to provide a space for networking and connection is expected to be formed in the coming year.
3. 20 public sessions were held by LPC with Community Based Organizations and local authorities to respond to the needs of communities through COVID pandemic
4. Following the review of 300 resumes, 20 champions for social cohesion have been selected. The champions have proposed initiatives to implement in their communities in 2021.

target.value: 1. 35 community mechanisms established and capacitated in the liberated areas (25 LPCs. 4 women groups and 6 youth platforms)

title.narrative: Output indicator 1.4: National systems for coordination and planning social cohesion and reconciliation efforts in Iraq
National systems for coordination and planning social cohesion and reconciliation efforts in Iraq

target.value: 1. Two roundtables between community based mechanisms and national legal government for advocacy, trust building, policy development. 2. 5 web series produced and disseminated 3. One Social media competition 4. 10 audio/visual products

actual.value: 1. One national workshop has been convened in Baghdad gathering CCPC with all 24 LPCs members 2. 5 web series produced and disseminated. 3. The social cohesion art competition launched in spring 2020 received over 100 submissions. Following selection of winners by a panel of influencers and staff, various submissions for film, visual art, and written word have been used by UNDP to increase awareness around social cohesion. 4. 19 audio/visual products produced

target.value:
1. One national women’s forum created and capacitated
2. 5 web series produced and disseminated
3. One Social media competition
4. 5 audio/visual products 5. 2 roundtables between community-based mechanisms and national level government for advocacy. trust building. policy development

actual.value: 1. The ongoing situation in the country. has affected focus and positions of the national advisor of women affairs. and the head of women empowerment department /COMSEC and shifted their authorities to form the national women group. A high women council have been formed during the reporting period. the prime minister is the chairman of this council and they are in the process of selecting women members. consultation will be re-initiated with this council after finalizing its form and tasks from the governmental side. 2. Local production company has been recruited after competitive process to produce 5 audio visual stories that will be disseminated as web series. Three stories have been identified from women from Diyala. Anbar and Mosul. Other two stories from young people will be identified in quarter four. 3. No social media competition launched. New work plan includes the implementation of this activity in Q3 2020. 5. No roundtable has been conducted so far. Preparation is ongoing.

target.value: 1. Maintain engagement between the national and Local level mechanism 2. 2 Study tour domestic regional and international

title.narrative: Output indicator 1.3: Civil society capacities strenghtened to become more effective partners in social cohesion and peace-building
Civil society capacities strengthened to become more effective partners in social cohesion and peace-building

target.value:
1. 9 forums for young media professionals are created in (Ninawa. Anbar and Diyala)
2. 10 media exposure by media professionals (TV/Radio programmes)

actual.value:
1. Two Young media Professionals forums took place in 2019. with the University of Anbar in Ramadi on March 23 and the University of Mosul on March 31. launching a debate between 200 participants. on the roles of Media and the youth could play for social cohesion.
2. Not implemented. The project has now hired international media expert and international specialist media targets. However. the project was able to produce media messages and coverage on social cohesion which have reached over 15 different widely viewed media platforms

target.value:
1. 14 forums for young media professionals are created(cumulative target)
2. 20 media exposure produced by citizens engagement

actual.value:
1. Workshops to capacitate 120 young media professionals (students of media colleges and active bloggers) began during the 4th quarter and are expected to carry on into the new year. An online platform aimed to publish media products and articles by the journalists is currently in the development and design stage.
2. In 2020, 10 news segments, short videos, and radio spots my media professionals have covered the two distribution campaigns, youth group activities, the Covenant of Peace signing in Muhalibiya, the Local Peace Committee workshop in Baghdad, and the social cohesion art contest. These media outlets include Al Jazeera, Mosul Times, Al Anbar Channel, Radio al-Salam, Al Sabah newspaper, and Iraqia TV.

target.value: 1. The 14 forums of young media professionals are functional and delivering 14 major activities
